text: {{Infobox writer | name = Anna Jókai | honorific_prefix = | honorific_suffix = | image = Anna Jókai 2015-09 (PICT4954).jpg | image_size = 220px | alt = | caption = Anna Jókai at Gothenburg Book Fair in 2015 | native_name = | native_name_lang = | pseudonym = | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = Budapest, Hungary | death_date = | death_place = Warsaw, Poland | resting_place = | occupation = Writer, Teacher | language = | nationality = Hungarian | ethnicity = | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = | period = | genre = | subject = | movement = | notableworks = | spouse = | partner = | children = | relatives = | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | years_active = | module = | website = | portaldisp = }} Anna Jókai (Hungarian: Jókai Anna) (24 November 1932 – 5 June 2017) was a Hungarian author, poet and teacher. She began her writing career in 1974 and, during the 1980s, she participated in the Hungarian liberation movement. Between 1990 and 1992, she was the chairperson of the Hungarian Writers' Union.Jokai Anna kossuth dija melle Irodalmijelen.hu Retrieved 30 September 2015 ==Awards== In 1994 and 2014, she received the Hungarian Kossuth Award. ==Bibliography== *Kötél nélkül, 1969 *A labda, 1971/1994 *Napok,1972/2001 *Mindhalálig, 1974 *A feladat , 1977/1996 *Szegény Sudár Anna, 1989/1999 *Ne féljetek , 1998 *Bölcsek és Pásztorok, 2006 ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1932 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Hungarian novelists Category:Hungarian poets Category:Hungarian educators Category:Writers from Budapest
title: Anna Jókai
